intro: Tetracme quadricornis var. longicornis, commonly known as the longhorned tetracme, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its unique morphological features, including the elongated floral bracts, make it distinctive within its genus. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
